reviews.text: For anyone with dermatologist appointments this is the best place to go. Thanks to a wonderful staff of doctors and assistants. I recommend this place to everyone.

Pro: Unmistakably a university. Many nice bricks. Has a piece of the Berlin Wall. I am told the libraries work properly. 
Con: Seems like it may be controlled by secret societies. No, really, there are too many of them and they leave sinister marks all over campus. No joke here.
Very nice school. Great professors and students. A one of a kind school in America.
Sadly this school is turning into another safe space, where any speech that doesn't fit the liberal profile is banned. A terrible turn for a once-decent institution.
Pretty nice campus, but I can't speak to the academics.

Wow! We had a great time on this tour. We arrived a little after 4pm and we the only ones on our tour. We were treated to a wonderful viewing of the house and lots of great stories about Monroe and his family. Even though we didn't get to spend much time on the grounds, the price of admission was still worth it. Highly recommended!

Went here for evening music program held during summer months. It's free! Bring a picnic but they also have food trucks and beer/wine for sale. The performers were great. There is a pavillion with tables or an expansive lawn for seating. Family friendly. We enjoyed ourselves and I would recommend you take advantage of this great opportunity if you can!

Peaceful retreat in the Virginia hills.  Beautiful trees, especially the 300+ yr old white oak.  Our guide was well versed and informative.  The guest house is well preserved with actual furnishings.  The original upholstery on the couch in the parlor is amazing!  A must see for history buffs and patriots alike.

Beautiful estate.
Great for events.
Disappointing to drive there to see the James Monroe house, pay the price, and THEN find out his house is no longer standing. A bit misleading. There are other buildings and some of the Monroe family's furnishings. However, the guide was very knowledgeable and answered all questions asked, even a few that were not directly concerning Monroe.☺

Beautiful property and buildings. Well maintained. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and answered all our questions. Lots of original furniture and art owned by President Monroe. Gift shop was nice and had lots of unique gifts and memorabilia.

Everything here is directed towards being expensive and selling you something. Be careful with your wallet, it can add up really quickly. Generally high end items here being sold, fudge my the ounce, high end watches and clothing, not for the faint of heart.

Awesome walking downtown mall. You'll get to enjoy the city life style to a bit and great options for dining. Evenings on a shiny day experience is wonderful. Summer weekend weekend evenings at Pavilion is good for families and kids.
The heart of Charlottesville! What a wonderful place to visit during any season. Stroll long the brick paved streets, and shop and dine in this historic location.

The Down Town mall used to be an awesome place to shop and eat. Some of the good restaurants are gone. There are still a few but not worth the trip. The pan handlers and homeless population there has grown so it feels unsafe most of the time. There are other safer places to shop. I feel it's lost its magic.
Love the layout and old building.  Just wish there was more.  Love the book store.

I wish there were more for kids to do, and somewhere to sit when wine testing that had a roof over it, even an umbrella on the table would have been nice.  The wine is excellent! I really liked their season specialties... The apple cider slushy is great! My favorite wine was the raspberry, had to buy a bottle of that!  Fun and friendly staff too.  If you're looking for a pumpkin patch for your little ones I wouldn't go here unless they add more activities for them.

Lots of good food, cider, and wine here. Love the cider donuts. You can't beat the view from atop the mountain, and if you love apples, this is the place to go for a huge variety that you can pick or buy already bagged. Peaches are another offering that is quite good. Right now it is winter and out of season but check their website and visit in season.

This place is worth taking a day off to visit.  It’s very pretty and the apples are the best I have ever tasted, but perhaps I haven’t had many freshly picked apples.  My husband agreed with me.  We both will visit again next year.

I love this place for having a nice fall outing.  If you have never visited, this is a privately owned orchard that has built a business based on allowing people to come pick their own apples and peaches. There is also a barn that holds craft items and other goods like local jams and honey. If you do not want to go pick the fruit yourself, there are bins of apples by the barn in multiple varieties.  Pumpkins are available and hay rides seasonally. They also sell apple cider donuts that are amazing. The frozen cider is also the best as it is not overly sweet at all.  They also sell pies, hamburgers, hot dogs and other simple foods. There is a back porch with seating and great views.  There is also a bold rock cider tasting room. Worth a visit if you are in the area.

Apple picking with a diverse age group was hilarious. The food was pretty good just watch out for the cash and food touchers. The wine tasting was amazing. Really enjoyed my entire visit. The photo opportunities are amazing. Make sure you bring a real camera and not just your cell phone. The walk is insane from the vineyard to the concession area where apple picking begins. But eating the grapes and berries along the way made up for it. Also a word to the wise make sure to where hiking boots for a better experience.
For anyone with dermatologist appointments this is the best place to go. Thanks to a wonderful staff of doctors and assistants. I recommend this place to everyone.

Pro: Unmistakably a university. Many nice bricks. Has a piece of the Berlin Wall. I am told the libraries work properly. 
Con: Seems like it may be controlled by secret societies. No, really, there are too many of them and they leave sinister marks all over campus. No joke here.
Very nice school. Great professors and students. A one of a kind school in America.
Sadly this school is turning into another safe space, where any speech that doesn't fit the liberal profile is banned. A terrible turn for a once-decent institution.
Pretty nice campus, but I can't speak to the academics.
Great atmosphere. Amazing venue for events. They have the best motto ever and really live by it "love not hate". Down side is food isn't really that good and it's over priced

An interesting business. It manages to cultivate arguably the most "traditional" atmosphere of any store on the mall while still serving modern food. I usually of here to play pool, for which Rapture is superior to most other establishments, so I can't really speak to the bar experience, but it seems friendly. My only complaint is that the space often feels cluttered.

I gave this place 4 stars. I would have given them a 5 but the waitress didn't really want to be involve with serving us. When my friend and I told her that we were from out of town and we ask what was good, she acted as if she really didn't want to be bothered with us. When my friend's food was undercook, my friend took her own plate to the cook herself. The cook was very polite and apologize for the undercook meal and fixed it right away. The food was well seasoned and delicious but the service wasn't as good as we expected.
Not a typical night club more of a country little bar in my opinion. Food was ok. Not crowded earlier in the night. Gets jam packed after 10:30
One of my favorite places to eat on the downtown mall. Staff is always friendly and the food is always good!

Disappointment.  The menu looked great online and on the window but when my wife and I sat down we were handed a stained paper menu with about 6 salads and 6 entrees.  My choice wasn't on the list and had to try the "leg" of lamb.  It turned out to be a dry, recooked lamb steak with little flavor.  My wife's gnocci was bland except for the excessive use of garlic.  If they spent half the time working on making the food better as they do designing the plate it might be edible.  DO NOT GO!
Excellent Italian food. The bruschetta was the best I have ever had, and the sauce over the sweet potato gnocchi was great. One of my top three restaurants in Cville
I liked the food.
service is non existent

If you are vegan you need to try this place.  Coconut rice, chickpea spring rolls and general tso’s  cauliflower 😋 We are from VA Beach and were delighted to find this place. They have their own vegan menu🙌🏻

Aaamzing! I never knew this place was here until a friend recommended it. I enjoyed this place more than mas and tavola, my previous two favorite restaurants in town. Every staff member seemed happy, sweet, and extremely friendly (especially Chelsea). The food and drinks were unique, tasty, and very well priced. We were impressed and will definitely be back to try different, interesting items on the menu, hopefully for a similar experience. Expect a wait, but it is so worth it!

This is an awesome restaurant. While it can be busy at peak hours - it’s because the food is amazing. My suggestions is ordering two tapas/aps per person and sharing them. It’s not just another “upscale tapas” restaurant - the food is unique and different than ordinary restaurants. 

While I would consider the food to be upscale, do not feel like you have to dress up fancy to go here, but look nice. I’ve been here twice and it’s definitely a spot I will go back to next time I’m in C’ville.
Such a fun time! Loved my drinks and food. Chelsea and Camille kept me company, and I had an amazing time. Will definitely come back next time I’m in town!
Great low key tapas and martini bar.  BBQ Tacos and pork belly buns were awesome.

I had the calamari special and the mushroom tart. My significant other was in the mood for comfort food so had the meatloaf and a soup special. The specials are usually pretty good. The calamari was on a slaw bed and was a little saucy but delicious. The tart was really rich with the balsamic reduction.

Very cool place located in the central walking district of Charlottesville. The restaurant fills up fast and there's not really any place to wait, so get there early. The cooks pay attention to the food, everything was delicious and well portioned. Staff is knowledge about what's on the menu and are open to talk about the place and food. Very fun night out.

This is one of the most unique restaurants in the Downtown Outdoor Mall in Charlottesville. The menu changes almost daily, so it's never the same thing twice. This place participates in restaurant week, bringing in more business than usual. Reservations are highly recommend. Quite pricey.
Bizou is on the mall in Charlottesville Virginia. A small venue inside and seating on the mall. A full bar and good food round out this pleasant venue
Great food, not oversized helpings. Waiters very friendly. Excellent service!
Bring cash, get there early, and enjoy! This place has absolutely delicious breakfast and is home-cooked-made-from-scratch. Vegan and vegetarian options. Very good service. Can't wait to go back!
My breakfast was perfect! I got the banana fosters french toast. It was delicious!! We had to wait about 45 minutes for a table, but well worth it!

Great service and great flavors!  I love eating here.  I've been probably over 20 times and I'm still not bored of it.  The benedicts and pancakes are great.  The specials over some variety and there are a lot of unique flavor combinations.  It gets busy and waits can get long so come early.  Also it's cash only.

Always great food here! I usually try to come on a weekday to avoid the long wait, but even if there is a wait it’s worth it! I usually get their savory options (corned beef hash, omelets and portobello mushroom hash are awesome!) but tried their bananas foster pancakes this time and I’m glad I did! They might be my new go-to! Love their bacon and their home fries as well! Bluegrass Grill and Bakery is a must-try!

Best brunch I've had in a long time. We both had the friends with Benedict. Amazing. Brie cheese, raspberry jam, and ham. Jalapeno hollandaise sauce. Amazing! Small, quaint, friendly atmosphere. Friendly staff. Beware: cash or check only.

Ice cream here is outstanding. Ice cream on the downtown mall or even in Charlottesville. Recommended by a local and I don't regret it even my son left it the ice cream is homemade and the service is good it is very quaint little shop very old-school with antiques. there are old black-and-white movies playing in the background and it gives you that old-school vibe. they have a kids cone that is very affordable and we go there all the time literally best ice cream in the Charlottesville area hands-down
Fun icecream shop like a throwback in time. This place is great for families or for a casual getting to know you date.
I went once, tried a German chocolate shake. BEST shake I've had in my lifetime. Highly recommend.

The owner of this restaurant is frequently around visiting his customers and genuinely loving the interaction. It's so rare to see an owner taking such an interest in his customers! From the moment you walk through the doors you are treated like family, with absolutely delicious food, wonderful handmade ice cream, epic milkshakes (TRY THE MOCHA MINT SHAKE IT'S AWESOME!) And all the staff are very friendly and they genuinely care for their customers. I love love love coming here for breakfast lunch or dinner, they are even worth the stop in just for a cup of coffee in the morning, it will definitely brighten your day!
Tony has own this ice cream shop for over 30 years..he makes his own ice cream everyday..come to downtown mall and buy a cone..great taste

We had to wait about ten minutes to be seated, even though we had a reservation, which was still way less than for those without a reservation. The service was phenomenal and the food was out of this world delicious. Our waitress brought us bread to hold us over while our meal was being made. I had the prime rib and my girlfriend has the salmon. We shared a side of mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. The sides are huge! We didn't have any alcohol, but there was a large selection of wine on the back of the menu. It was a great evening out. We definitely recommend.
Excellent dishes. A bit pricey by Charlottesville standards but not compared to DC or Richmond.  Great service.

Good food, service, and location......   I am editing my previous review of 5 stars from a few years ago. We went recently and were very disappointed in the food and service. Not sure what happened but it was like it had all new management and staff to include the chef. Not going again anytime soon.

Classiest place in Cville! But need to install wall dividers in gentleman's restroom for privacy. Also servers need a bit more training in hospitality. Hence only 4 stars.
 – Author – 
THE WHISTLEBLOWER: Defeating Bullies, Harassers & Management Gang Retaliation 
(available on Amazon)

We have eaten here many times and have always been impressed with the service and the food. Tonight was different. Our waiter was very distracted. He came to our table several times. Dropped off a menu, said he would be back to get our drink order. Dropped off our water and said he would be back to get our drink order again. He promised to come back to get our food order three times. He brought us bread and butter with no silverware or napkins. We decided not to get an appetizer and ordered our food as soon as we were given the opportunity. It was over an hour before we were fed. The food was excellent as always. In the past the service has always been excellent which is why this is our favorite place to eat when we go out. This poor guy needs some remedial training for fine dining service.  He was maybe in the weed a little bit but we were made to feel unappreciated. We will still come back over the holidays but we may ask for a different server.
Best place downtown to go. Never had a bad experience. The owner is one of the nicest people on the planet as well as the staff. Can't go wrong.
Fun but ratchet place (in a good way).  RIP.
Always a pleasure! Food is awesome! I'm a 4 star Master Chef and I have never been disappointed !! Friendly people and a great staff!! Exceptional laid back fun place to just b you!!

Chill, friendly place with good food & beautiful patio. Hands down the best late-night spot in Charlottesville on Fridays & Saturdays, with a diverse (straight/gay/black/white/international/students/locals) young crowd.
The owner is so sweet and very customer service focused. I live techno music so it was perfect for me!  Thanks for a great Saturday night.  The dance floor was full!

Food is good, but service is terrible. We made a reservation for 7pm, and when we arrived, they told us they could not find the reservation but there's a table that would be ready in "just a few minutes". So we waited, and at 7:30pm, they said they were "setting up the table now". And we waited, at 8pm, we finally sat down after waiting for an hour, and there were actually A LOT OF empty tables in the restaurant. They simply could not care less.
Excellent food choices and preparation, skill and engaging wait staff, and delightful ambience.   A must visit place that feeds the palette and the soul!

Great French Cuisine with awesome pates decoration. I have been here since 3 months and every time i went in the manager always surprise with a new appetizer. Place is clean and decorated for a comfort dining.

Superb cuisine and excellent service.  I took my wife there for our anniversary and we enjoyed an evening of fine dining
 Sommelier service was excellent and the food refined.  We did the tasting menu with wine pairing, which I highly recommend.
They had wine in almost every option but they were considerate enough to customize them for me. Overall, great tasting food.

A surprising experience.  I love hole in the wall, unusual restaurants.  We thoroughly enjoyed the reasonably priced buffet.  I don't usually love Indian food, but this was awesome.  Service was a little slack, but what the heck.. we had time, and it was a buffet at all.
We had dinner in Himalayan Fusion and the food is wonderful. The staffs are friendly. This place is also dog friendly. I would recommend this place.
Excellent buffet for lunch. Exotic and delicious food at reasonable prices. Staff not particularly friendly but its a buffet so no problem.
Best value on the mall. Delicious food, excellent price, honest, hard-working owners. Ideal spot for lunch or dinner.
Lamb samosas were salty and not great. The lamb saag was wonderful. The food was very slow despite us being 1 of 2 couples there. Luckily I liked my date!
Saturday evening dinner outside was great. Loved our waitress Anna! Great prices and great seating. Food was delish and well priced. Definitely coming back again.

Way better than I expected! Prices are decent and, despite having a smoking floor, there was no smoke smells in here at all! This was a concern of mine, but I’m glad I gave it a shot! The chicken fingers look pretty damn good, but I ended up getting some appetizers.

THE best lobster bisque!!  I could have ten bowls and I consider myself fairly broadly experienced as I adore bisque!  Great chunks of lobster, prices are SUPER reasonable and service is extremely welcoming.  We had a quick meeting in town but this was a highlight meal of our whole trip.
I got food poising here (and still want to come back) that's how delicious the Hand Dipped Corn Dogs are. However, if cigar smoke bothers you... I would ask to be seated outside.
The kitchen was closed temporarily while a piece of equipment was being repaired but my meal still came out promptly and was delicious.

Went there for a Saturday Buffet date with wife and we had a great evening. The place has nicely set up the ambiance for a romantic dinner date  They serve some really good  food, spread was limited but nicely curated. The desert section was my favorite as it had a lot of variety.

Not at all a great place at that price. Nothing great about ambience or food. Small place actually. Staff service is good and courteous. Less staff. You need to go hotel reception to pay your bill. No ice cream in the desert.
Food is good but limited starters in buffet. ambience was good. If you want have some privacy like closed doors environment I would suggest not to choose monsoon

A descent place to dine-in. Courteous staff and good service.

Food - we tried pizza, pasta and desserts. Pizza was very good but pasta disappointed a bit in terms of taste and quality. The raspberry cheesecake was not good but chocolate bomb was unique.
Ambience - average.
Service - very good staff.

It's been quite some time and we were craving for buffet lunch. After looking for multiple options, we found this to be better than others. This buffet was labelled as fit and healthy so we were also excited for some amazing healthy stuff. Since we reached there just when the buffet started so we thought main course items are yet to be kept. To our greatest surprise there was no main course. So the menu comprised of salads and desserts which is so weird and bizarre. The only main course option was cold burger and cold sandwich which was terrible. Except for khao suey soup and couple of salads n desserts, majority of the offerings were average to below average. The most horrific of all was papadi chaat where the ingredients were papadi and dahi, neither it was healthy nor justified to not put basic ingredients. Healthy doesn't mean non inclusion of basic items. With salads which anyways is an indispensable part of the buffet plus umpteen desserts which has nothing to do with healthiness this buffet was the worse ever experience so far. Coming to their service, it was again not even close to what we expected. The serving folks lacked basic skills in regard to everything. The only sigh of relief was the ambience which was surely in line with what we expected. Overall not suggested in any case!!!

A quaint diner located in the heart of downtown.  The menu and ambiance bring a flood of memories back as there are featured historical photos everywhere.
The service was excellent and the food was fresh and very tasty.
This is a hidden gem among all of the restaurants along the street...I highly recommend making a stop. 
My BLT sandwich was loaded with crisp bacon and fresh veggies...So good...
I will definitely dine here again.

We had a quick lunch prior to participating in an afternoon concert.  The open face roast beef sandwich has real mashed potatoes!  And the BBQ meatloaf sandwich was tasty. This is a nice diner, with a bar as an unusual complement to the food.  You can get breakfast any time, and have a Mimosa to go with it! Prices are reasonable, too. Busy place but you're attended to by several waitstaff, including  (I think) the owner.
Great dinner experience and breakfast all day. You will need to add your own salt/pepper to the food. Indoor and outdoor seating!

Classic 1951 diner with a mix of traditional and updated Southern fare. We had "four egg" omelets; I'd have to guess small eggs. Nicely prepared. Not much cheese, but the vegetables were plentiful and lightly cooked. Good coffee that keeps on coming.

Really quaint old-school diner. Two of my kids got afternoon breakfast (the pancake order is enormous) and the rest of us got sandwiches. Everything tasted good and we had leftover pancakes in the morning.
Great atmosphere. Amazing venue for events. They have the best motto ever and really live by it "love not hate". Down side is food isn't really that good and it's over priced

An interesting business. It manages to cultivate arguably the most "traditional" atmosphere of any store on the mall while still serving modern food. I usually of here to play pool, for which Rapture is superior to most other establishments, so I can't really speak to the bar experience, but it seems friendly. My only complaint is that the space often feels cluttered.

I gave this place 4 stars. I would have given them a 5 but the waitress didn't really want to be involve with serving us. When my friend and I told her that we were from out of town and we ask what was good, she acted as if she really didn't want to be bothered with us. When my friend's food was undercook, my friend took her own plate to the cook herself. The cook was very polite and apologize for the undercook meal and fixed it right away. The food was well seasoned and delicious but the service wasn't as good as we expected.
Not a typical night club more of a country little bar in my opinion. Food was ok. Not crowded earlier in the night. Gets jam packed after 10:30
One of my favorite places to eat on the downtown mall. Staff is always friendly and the food is always good!

Amazing food! The samosas were on point and the grits (I think it was called mealy pap or something) that came with the chicken were probably the best I've ever had.

The price per person is a touch high though. Like approx $20/person high.

With that said, I would still absolutely recommended trying Shebeen out. You won't be sorry!
I go for the mussels... they are the best! Great late night eats and the patio bar has swings! My sweetie likes cigars at the outdoor smoking area
Really enjoyed. The food had great flavors/spice and the portions were pretty large for a town that seems to be trends towards the small plate theme. We will certainly be coming back.
Brunch was good. The El Burro breakfast burrito was delicious and the Bloody Mary was pretty good, too. My 5th grader declared the potatoes perfect!

This place is tucked into an unremarkable strip mall which could make it a bit hard to find.  Honestly, the place doesn't look like much special, but you should seek it out; the "African Influenced" menu is worth the trip.  The flavors and  dishes of their menu are really unique.  While we weren't impressed with the calamari appetizer, the samosas and our entrees were just absolutely delicious.  We'd go back here again if we come back to Charlottesville.

So, we have a lot of great restaurants around....ten is one of then. Low lighting. Low music. Super chill and fancy. Great for date night. Not a good place for kids. Or for the hungry. Have a snack or eat some pizza or something before you go. It's a place to go for tasting amazing fish, not for stuffing your face (unless you want to drop 300 bucks). Two people can have a good experience for around 80 (not including drinks). Best sushi around though.

So glad I tried this Ten for restaurant week! Every selection we tried was so tasty! The waiter was super accommodating and made our meal even more enjoyable! The fish is super fresh and the sushi rice is incredibly well seasoned. Love love love and will definitely be back again!
One of my fav locations for Japanese food. fell in love with this place from the 1st taste. staff treated us so nice. they have a lot of positive reviews for a reason.
Best I have had,  hands down!  Do yourself a favor and get the wagyu beef on the sizzling rock-  amazing!!

Somewhat expensive but great dining experience and amazing food. The ambience in the restaurant is gorgeous, waiters/waitresses were kind, and service was fast. Just get a reservation or you'll be waiting a while.

Over multiple visits, everything I ordered was excellent. The sushi tasted fresh, and this is one of the only places in Charlottesville you can get decent unagi (eel) rolls. I also loved the marbled tuna sushi. It's got the perfect mix of fat and tender meat creating a thick, luxurious texture, augmenting the already rich taste. It's not for everyone but if you like fat and sushi, you have to get it.

The lobster tempura was good, juicy with a delicious sauce, but slightly overdone. The wagyu beef was served on a hot rock, and cooked to perfection. Just had such a rich taste and texture that it melted in my mouth. The harami trio was good, well cooked and seasoned, but not to the level of the wagyu steak.

Deserts were also excellent. I really enjoyed the puffy and light donuts with coffee as well as the rich, crumbly chocolate cake with ice cream. Mochi ice cream was unremarkable, but good.

Love this place so much, good vibes and great tea. Hookah is also good, but for those of you that don't partake, it's usually done in the back where the smoke doesn't interfere with other customers. Not wheelchair friendly.
A lovely, cozy little spot to grab a light bite and a beer, or even tea and a hookah! Super chill environment. Pillows abound!
Many good teas and drinks to choose from. One of the only hookah places in cville
Super fun atmosphere with a large selection for any palette to be happy! Truly great for catching up with a friend or a quick moment for yourself.

Atmosphere, atmosphere, atmosphere! I wish I had the time to sit on the back outdoor deck or the sun room porch area with a pot of tea, a book and my crocheting! All kinds of great tea to try and lots of cute, very inexpensive t-shirts to buy!

Loved the vibe, lots of older hip hop hits played at a reasonable volume and the bar wasn't too crowded. Bartenders were fast getting drinks, though the drinks were quite expensive at $8.50 for a tequila shot. The atmosphere is much chiller than the other downtown bars, which made the pricing a bit more palatable.
Great experience. The customer service was excellent. We went during restaurant week and there was a variety of selections. The cheese fritters were exceptional. We would visit again.
INCREDIBLE!!! Everything we ordered was just amazing! Cannot recommend enough! Great friendly service, romantic environment, and did I mention the food? Can't wait to go back! So impressed!
The duck breast was good.  I strongly recommend it.  But the dessert wasn't worth it.  It was barely okay.
Great service and awesome food, we'll be going back.

My time at the Alley Light last night was one of the worst experiences I’ve had at a restaurant in my twenty-three years of enjoying Charlottesville fine dining and beverages. 

I’ve been to the restaurant before and enjoyed the food and cocktails and have recommended the restaurant to many family and friends. However, last night I experienced the most unenthusiastic, presumptuous, and disrespectful bartender and serving staff and can no longer in good faith recommend this place to anyone. 

If you are interested in paying a lot of money for delicious drinks, average food, and horrible hospitality / service - this place is for you. But if you are like most people who admire a restaurant built and grounded on respect, good service, and true hospitality - I’d recommend you take your business elsewhere.

Went for our anniversary. Made reservations and we were seated promptly at a nice intimate table. The ambiance was great. We were greeted with free champagne for the occasion. Food was superb. Service was excellent. Had a great evening and we will we returning!

Great speakeasy vibe! Drinks were amazing - quality ingredients were worth the price.  Highly recommend their version of the Moscow Mule with homemade ginger beer. Glanced at the food menu, but it seemed fussier and more expensive than I was interested in for a casual Thursday night.
Very nice! Small, but good.  We came for drinks only, so no idea about food. The drinks were delicious and the bartenders were attentive and helpful.

My girlfriend and I were out and she suggested we stop in for a quick bite. It was my first time and I must say my experience was great. I had the pick 2 with the turkey wrap (which had apple butter on it) and broccoli and cheddar soup.  

I travel a lot and try a bunch of different foods and restaurants. The Alley Light is on my list anytime I'm in Charleston!

Delightful dining experience. Excellent service both times we have eaten here. Fabulous food. The risotto was wonderful (both times). The salmon gnocchi was amazing. Tavola is not cheap but is well worth the price. And don't skip dessert.

Great service, the food was amazing! The lobster Mac and cheese is to die for. The Alfredo was also delicious! Cocktails were great and wine selection is extensive. The bread and marinara they bring out is exceptional. Highly recommend!

The food was great and the chocolate creme brûlée was the neat part of the meal the fruit infusion tea was amazing too. We were seated immediately and our server pearl was so kind and friendly and we had a. Overall great experience

Their U District pizza gave us flashbacks to our trip to Italy - it was mouthwatering good and we were glad for the cucumber-y water. Their other dishes looked and smelled divine as well. Hoping to go back in the near future to try them. Service was great.

Fine dinning isn’t Dead. This is a top Italian restaurant that serves some of the best food. Centrally located and just a short walk to the town square. Thank you for the wonderful dinning experience.

I just love to visit this place for the pizza. They serve one of the largest and best pizza one can ever have. the staff here is very helpful and polite. Garlic bread is also one of the best things of this place.

This is my go-to place for pizza! Their specialty pizzas are great, fresh, and taste authentic. Def not garbage pizza! Their salads are actually pretty good too - the spinach salad is delish and a good compliment to a pizza dinner. The best in Belmont!

This place is very popular with locals, the regulars are devoted. Fun, quiet unsophisticated atmosphere with a bar, patio, and outdoor seating. The pies are tasty with a chewy thin crust and interesting toppings. Service is consistently great. Unisex bathrooms. Fun times, especially for groups.
Yummy. Fast service and with care. Great portion sizes. Nice place to hang out too. Quality and safety conscience focused too. Not afraid to make things right. Awesome!

Not sure what I was expecting when I waked in, but this place was fantastic! Extremely friendly servers who were always making sure we were satisfied. And the salads and pizzas we ordered were delicious! Would 10/10 recommend!
Lovely place, lovely food. Caesar salad and corn cheese balls are dope. Awesome ambiance and great place to hangout. Always a favorite.
Best place to eat for classic American Italian. Very typical fare, pizza is not very good. Stick with the basics and keep it simple.
College Inn is the same as it was years ago, which is great! Solid Italian menu, pizza and efficient, friendly staff. Thanks!
Good food, nice inside. The only complaint would be parking on the very busy street.

Came to my house three days ago delivered pepperoni pizza payed with cash and now they don’t deliver with out a card for the first time. Two things wrong with that statement, and this happened 12/01/18 at 1:35 pm.

Never again!!

Delivery took more than 2 hours.
The "groentenmix" suppose to be tempura vegetables, but contained prawn tempura (my wife is allergic to it) and there was a hair in the Yaki Udong Tori Teriyaki.....

All in all a real disappointment.
Super lekkere sushi, zowel om af te halen of om thuis te laten bezorgen. Regelmatig wat besteld altijd goed. Ze zijn snel!

Wij bestellen, of halen altijd af bij sakura als we thuis sushi gaan eten. Elke keer opnieuw weer top service. Sushi smaakt ons elke keer weer voortreffelijk en altijd z'n 45 min bezorgtijd. Zelfs vandaag op 2e kerstdag, wanneer er iets mis ging met onze bestelling, kregen we netjes een nieuw product. (Terwijl dit niet nodig was!) Het is dat ik nooit cash in huis heb, anders had ik zeker wat fooi als bedankje erbij gedaan! (Sorry daarvoor 🙈) Tot de volgende bestelling :)
Goede sushi kwaliteit. Stond op tijd klaar. Minpunt dat een blikje drinken niet was meegeleverd.
De beste sushi van Apeldoorn en heel veel keus in wat je wilt eten. Komen wel altijd later bezorgen dan je besteld en dat is wel teleurstellend. Maar heerlijk!

Great experience at Sushi King tonight- all of my sushi rolls were delicious, the service was super fast, and the wait staff was very friendly. The "clean your plate" rule was a fun new experience, and I left subsequently stuffed, but happy. Definitely worth a visit!
Was concerned it wouldn't be good for my grandchildren, but it was excellent.  Plenty of kid friendly food for non-sushi eaters. And soft serve ice cream was a big hit.

We've been to this location before and weren't very impressed. After seeing the new menus that descriptively show the individual sushi rolls, we were curious to try the new additions. We think they underwent new training or new hires or something because this experience was unlike ours previously! The sushi rolls were fresh, very well presented and came in a timely manner. Our server was also more attentive to our needs than previous servers. We very much enjoyed this visit.
All you can eat sushi for great price!  But it took a long time to get sushi out...  Make sure to order few rolls at at once or going to be waiting for awhile.
Extensive menu with yummy, fresh sushi and other items. It was a really fun place for my niece's birthday! They treated us really well.

Open since 1985, this place is known for their fun girlie drinks menu. The cheese fries are waffle fries and delicious. The beers were good and service was great. An odd thing about this place, it has no windows.

UPDATE: Sat outside at one of their 2-3 tables. The veggie burger was good. The staff was extra friendly. It's a fun college bar. They have high chairs if you are in need.

Very laid back and muted bar on the corner. Staff are very personable and sure to entertain. A place to casually drink with your friends and grab great food till 1AM! Tuesday night trivia is pretty intense too.
Great food.  Super friendly staff.  The Cajun wings were some of the best I have had anywhere, period.
Jimmy Buffet type of restaurant. Good burgers, bit of a hidden gem. Very popular with doctors from the hospital and medical school.

From my days at UVa, I always loved going to this bar.  It is tucked away on "The Corner" with a wood paneled interior exterior which adds to its casual appeal.  They have a good beer selection with some good local VA beers.  Go for the wings.  Honey Habenero are one of the hottest wings they have and have a good sweet spiciness.  They have other levels but it is not for the faint of heart.
This place is so good! I love the steak and cheese subs here. The staff is so incredibly friendly, my 4 yr old son has made a best buddy who works there. 10 out of 10!

if you are looking for an old school hamburger joint, this one fits the bill. With  classic counter seating , a variety of burger and sandwich choices, and a lot of history as well... It's a fun place to stop in. Located right across from the University, the biggest issue you will find is getting a place to park. But they have good burgers and fries reasonably priced if not cheap, and I found it was charming.

Very good food, especially when excited for very greasy fast food.  It's not high quality deluxe food, but you can't come here expecting that kind of food.  This place is perfect for a meal after going out to bars and having a good time.
Nice little counter service spot. Fast and inexpensive
Awesome little hole in the wall. Good food good service.

Had lunch here a couple of weeks ago with some coworkers.  There was only 1 other table of people eating.  Service (waiter) was slow and inattentive.  Pizza was ok but expensive ($24 for a large) and not really worth the money.  There's better pizza to be had on the corner for less money.
Staff was very nice and pizza was amazing! They have a cute outdoor patio with heaters.
Excellent pizza and salads. Very nice staff.
Good food, fun bar
Amazing pizza, convivial atmosphere, great drinks.

After having a fabulous experience with l'etoile catering for my son's bar mitzvah 3 years ago, I knew that I wanted Vickie to provide the food for my daughter's bat mitzvah.  She and her team did the kiddush luncheon as well as the Sunday brunch.  The food was delicious and the presentations were gorgeous!  My daughter's favorite is tomato basil soup and this was some of the best we have ever had.  And the chocolate truffles were over the top!  We might have hid some for just our family.  
The serving staff were attentive yet unobtrusive.  Our kitchen looked better after they left than before they started.  I would highly recommend l'etoile for your next event.

L'Etoile catered our wedding reception and it was everything I could have asked for. I felt so comfortable knowing that I had Vickie to help organize rentals (glasses, linens, tables, etc), decide how much alcohol to get, set up the space, etc. She truly is a catering expert and was unbelievably helpful with all of our questions/concerns. During cocktail hour, Vickie specifically sought out my husband and I to bring us appetizers and drinks. But most importantly, the food was OUTSTANDING! All my guests were raving about how it was the best wedding food they had ever had. All the meats were juicy and tender, the ingredients were fresh, and everything was flavorful. The wait staff was friendly and fun to have at the wedding. The price was higher than some places in the area, but lower than many others as well. I feel it was a good value. Would choose L'Etoile again a million times over!

Very good Indian buffet! The food was excellent and very fresh. One thing I really appreciated was the salad, which had cucumbers, red onion, and tomatoes, as well as a good creamy dressing. Another nice feature is that they bring fresh bread to your table one basket at a time. Everything I tried was good, but there was also a Chef's Special Chicken that was amazing, it was tandoori cooked so it was smokey and tender, but it had a more cumin based spice blend that I really enjoyed. The rice pudding with cashews was excellent, lightly sweet and satisfying. Definitely will come back!

The staff were beautiful and helpful and so kind. The food is always and amazing. My friend and I came in at the end of the lunch rush and they let us stay to eat even though they had closed to start preparing for dinner, they were so nice and accommodating! They joked with us and did not allow us to feel bad for staying even though they had a lot of work to do, we love Milan!

The place was full and we had to wait a little to order as well as to receive the food after ordering. However, once the food got there it was fabulous! The sauce/gravy was wonderful and the garlic nan was homemade heaven. Never been to India, so I cannot say how authentic it was.  However, this was no standard buffet-like food.
Great location to chill, eat some good food. Service is typically great. This place has an awesome atmosphere. Kinda of like a restaurant in Los Angeles I liked to visit.

For me, the best restaurant in c'ville. Food gets served fairly quickly, ample, nice staff.
This is our place of choice for 'official lunch / dinner' for visitors.
Incredible food, real bang for your buck with portions, fast delivery, friendly and quick service, my go to place by far. Love it. Favorites are orange chicken and pork fried rice.

The restaurant is bigger than it looks from the outside. Located in small strip style building. Parking is always crowded but there is hardly any customers in the restaurant. Food is always hot and freshly made. They offer some kind of chips and sweet and sour sauce complementary. Our kids like them.  The staff are friendly and give prompt service.
Great service and good vegan Chinese options in this comfortable but no frills eatery. They are expedient and the food is consistent. However, the bathrooms are always pretty terrible.

BEST CHINESE IVE HAD IN CHARLOTTESVILLE! I ordered online and it came in 25 mins. I ordered the beef and broccoli dinner combo with a sprite, cheese donuts and the steamed dumplings. Everything came hot and fresh, flavors are amazing and good prices. Highly highly recommend 😄
General Tso with just the right amount of heat very reasonably priced in a clean welcoming environment parking a little tight

Very good Indian buffet! The food was excellent and very fresh. One thing I really appreciated was the salad, which had cucumbers, red onion, and tomatoes, as well as a good creamy dressing. Another nice feature is that they bring fresh bread to your table one basket at a time. Everything I tried was good, but there was also a Chef's Special Chicken that was amazing, it was tandoori cooked so it was smokey and tender, but it had a more cumin based spice blend that I really enjoyed. The rice pudding with cashews was excellent, lightly sweet and satisfying. Definitely will come back!

The staff were beautiful and helpful and so kind. The food is always and amazing. My friend and I came in at the end of the lunch rush and they let us stay to eat even though they had closed to start preparing for dinner, they were so nice and accommodating! They joked with us and did not allow us to feel bad for staying even though they had a lot of work to do, we love Milan!

The place was full and we had to wait a little to order as well as to receive the food after ordering. However, once the food got there it was fabulous! The sauce/gravy was wonderful and the garlic nan was homemade heaven. Never been to India, so I cannot say how authentic it was.  However, this was no standard buffet-like food.
Great location to chill, eat some good food. Service is typically great. This place has an awesome atmosphere. Kinda of like a restaurant in Los Angeles I liked to visit.

For me, the best restaurant in c'ville. Food gets served fairly quickly, ample, nice staff.
This is our place of choice for 'official lunch / dinner' for visitors.

My wife and I enjoy coming here for an inexpensive and delicious meal. We enjoy both the fried chicken and the hamburgers, and look forward to the onion rings as well. They have a selection of desserts that are also delicious. Even better, the prices are more than reasonable, and that's why it's always full of locals.

I knew I had to make a trip to Charlottesville, so I made sure I found this place because I heard it was the best fried chicken in Virginia!  I couldn't agree more!  They fry it up FRESH!  I bought a whole bucket, drove home with it in my truck (2 hours away) and it was STILL very warm, fresh & delicious!   I had leftovers for lunch the next day, as well!  Very juicy, tender and not AT ALL greasy!!!  The staff was extremely friendly, kind, and patient with everyone.  It's a small place, but very busy!!!  I will be going back and dining in the next time and take advantage of the other items they have available on their menu, as well!  GOOD JOB MEN!

They have THE BEST CHICKEN!! Served from kind honest people. True comfort food. Definitely more than just a five star rating!  We are planning to cater their food for our Christmas party! Its That good! Thank you for the great food and nice folks!  :):)

First time being here. I wish i could give more than. Five stars. Thank you for your service an the food was amazing. The price of the food qas awesome. If you are in Charlottesville i would highly recommend stopping in for a bite to eat. You wont be disappointed that for sure
Best friend chicken in town. Genuinely nice staff. I cannot recommend it enough.
Veggie calzone was delicious and gigantic. Went on Tuesday for half off tall boy domestics and they had a great selection. Staff was friendly and attentive.
Great atmosphere with great service. You can't go wrong with this place. We ordered our food and we got it quick! Great selection of beers too!

We came from Georgia where I first encountered this chain. Over there the pizza was amazing. Simply to die for. And when we moved here I was so excited to see that there was a location near us. We drove from Lafayette to dine here because we loved the locations in Georgia so much. I was so disappointed. More like heartbroken. Our buffalo pizza stopped being made halfway up the pizza leaving a thick piece of crust. Our bbq chicken side was burnt. We asked for no onions on both sides there were onions. The crust was not like the other locations. It was hard. My son got the pretzel bites the only good thing that came to our table. It's what I expected my crust on my pizza to be. Our waitress forgot about us once it got busy. The host was the only reason this place got 2 stars. She was amazing and so friendly with my son. I think it needs to meet the management at other locations. Next time we will wait till I visit my in laws in Georgia. Such a huge let down. And dont tell me about it being burnt because it goes into an oven when 2 completely different locations have the same crust and same quality of food on the opposite sides of Georgia. There's something not right with this location.
A very clean  restaurant. Friendly staff not afraid to smile an say hello. Good food. Overall a pleasant experience
Great Pizza! Good servers with efficient service and decent serving time. Try the House special and the mighty meaty! The spinach dip is great too.
